Dosage_Adult: Treatment: 75 mg twice daily for 5 days; Prevention: 75 mg once daily for 10 days
Side_Effects: Nausea, vomiting, headache, diarrhea; rare behavioral changes/neuropsychiatric events
Interactions: None significant generally noted; check for specific drug interactions with your doctor
Warnings: Best started within 48 hours of symptom onset for treatment effectiveness. May cause rare behavioral changes (monitor closely, especially in children/teens).

Dosage_Adult: Single dose based on weight (e.g., 40 mg for 40kg to <80kg, 80 mg for >=80kg)
Interactions: Avoid co-administration with polyvalent cation-containing products (dairy, antacids)
Warnings: Not recommended for pregnant or breastfeeding women or hospitalized patients with severe illness.

Dosage_Adult: Treatment: 2 inhalations (10 mg total) twice daily for 5 days; Prevention: 2 inhalations once daily for 10 days
Interactions: None significant generally noted; check for specific drug interactions with your doctor
Warnings: Not recommended for people with underlying respiratory disease (e.g., asthma, COPD) due to risk of bronchospasm. Not for children under 7.

Dosage_Adult: Single dose of 600 mg administered intravenously
Side_Effects: Diarrhea, elevated blood sugar, elevated white blood cell counts
Interactions: None significant generally noted; check for specific drug interactions with your doctor
Warnings: Used in a clinical setting. Monitor for hypersensitivity reactions.

Dosage_Adult: Initial: 500 mg once or twice daily; gradually increased to 1000-2550 mg/day in divided doses
Side_Effects: Nausea, diarrhea, stomach upset, metallic taste, vitamin B12 deficiency (long-term use)
Interactions: Alcohol (increased risk of lactic acidosis), certain contrast dyes (temporary kidney impairment), certain heart medications
Warnings: Risk of lactic acidosis (rare but serious, especially with kidney problems). Monitor kidney function. Take with food to reduce GI side effects. Avoid excessive alcohol.

Dosage_Adult: Initial: 1.25-5 mg once daily; adjusted based on blood glucose response
Side_Effects: Hypoglycemia (low blood sugar), weight gain, nausea, skin rash
Interactions: Alcohol (disulfiram-like reaction), certain antifungal medications, NSAIDs, sulfa-containing drugs
Warnings: Risk of hypoglycemia; educate patients on recognizing and treating low blood sugar. Take with meals. May cause sensitivity to sunlight.

Dosage_Adult: Initial: 5 mg once daily; adjusted based on blood glucose response
Interactions: Alcohol, certain antifungal medications, NSAIDs, sulfa-containing drugs
Warnings: Risk of hypoglycemia; educate patients on recognizing and treating low blood sugar. Take about 30 minutes before a meal.

Side_Effects: Upper respiratory infection, sore throat, headache, diarrhea; rare pancreatitis, severe joint pain
Warnings: Rare risk of pancreatitis (report severe abdominal pain). May cause severe joint pain.

Dosage_Adult: 10-25 mg once daily in the morning
Side_Effects: Urinary tract infections, yeast infections, increased urination, dehydration, risk of diabetic ketoacidosis (rare), Fournier's gangrene (rare)
Interactions: Diuretics (increased risk of dehydration/hypotension), certain blood pressure medications
Warnings: Risk of genital yeast infections and UTIs. Rare but serious risk of diabetic ketoacidosis (even with normal blood sugar). Rare risk of Fournier's gangrene (severe genital infection). Monitor for dehydration.

Dosage_Adult: 0.75 mg or 1.5 mg injected subcutaneously once weekly
Side_Effects: Nausea, vomiting, diarrhea, abdominal pain, decreased appetite; rare pancreatitis, thyroid C-cell tumors
Interactions: None significant generally noted; may affect absorption of oral medications due to slowed gastric emptying
Warnings: Boxed warning for risk of thyroid C-cell tumors (seen in animal studies; unknown risk in humans). Not for patients with a history of medullary thyroid carcinoma or Multiple Endocrine Neoplasia syndrome type 2.

Possible_Conditions: Type 2 Diabetes (when oral medications are insufficient)
Dosage_Adult: Highly individualized dosage based on blood glucose levels and type of insulin
Side_Effects: Hypoglycemia, weight gain, injection site reactions, allergic reactions
Interactions: Certain diabetes medications, alcohol, certain blood pressure medications, sulfa-containing drugs
Warnings: Risk of hypoglycemia; educate patients on recognizing and treating low blood sugar. Requires careful monitoring of blood glucose. Store properly. Administer correctly via injection.

Dosage_Adult: 30-60 mg every 4-6 hours as needed; Extended-release forms available
Side_Effects: Increased heart rate, elevated blood pressure, nervousness, difficulty sleeping
Interactions: MAO inhibitors, certain blood pressure medications, stimulants
Warnings: May increase blood pressure/heart rate; Use with caution in individuals with heart conditions, high blood pressure, thyroid problems, or difficulty urinating. Not for children under 4.

Side_Effects: Similar to pseudoephedrine, but generally less potent effect on heart rate/BP
Interactions: MAO inhibitors, certain blood pressure medications
Warnings: Similar warnings to pseudoephedrine, though potentially milder.

Interactions: Certain antidepressants (SSRIs, MAOIs), other cough/cold medications
Warnings: Do not use for chronic cough without medical advice. Can cause dizziness/drowsiness. Avoid alcohol. Overuse can be dangerous.

Dosage_Adult: 200-400 mg every 4 hours as needed (max 2400 mg/day)
Warnings: Drink plenty of fluids to help the medication work effectively.

Side_Effects: Drowsiness, dizziness, dry mouth, blurred vision, difficulty urinating
Warnings: Causes drowsiness; Avoid driving or operating machinery. Avoid alcohol. May cause excitability in children. Use with caution in elderly.
